headline: Warner Bros. Discovery Surges 13% Amid Bold Restructuring to Tackle Streaming Revolution
summary: WBD's reorganization splits TV and streaming divisions, aligning with industry shifts from cable to digital dominance.

headline: Warner Discovery to Restructure, Setting Up Potential ‘Strategic Opportunities’
summary: The entertainment company would have two operating divisions, one focused on the legacy cable TV business and the other on streaming and studios.

raw.headline: Warner Discovery to Restructure, Setting Up Potential ‘Strategic Opportunities’
raw.summary: The entertainment company would have two operating divisions, one focused on the legacy cable TV business and the other on streaming and studios.

headline: Warner Bros. Discovery Stock Jumps on Plan to Split TV Business From Streaming Studios
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery became the latest media giant hit by the rise of cord-cutting and streaming to announce a restructuring, with plans to split its TV business from its streaming and film studios.

raw.headline: Warner Bros. Discovery Stock Jumps on Plan to Split TV Business From Streaming Studios
raw.summary: Warner Bros. Discovery became the latest media giant hit by the rise of cord-cutting and streaming to announce a restructuring, with plans to split its TV business from its streaming and film studios.

headline: Roku and FreeWheel Announce New Programmatic Partnership
summary: SAN JOSE, Calif., December 12, 2024--Today, Roku, the #1 TV streaming platform in the U.S.* and FreeWheel, a global technology platform for the television advertising industry, announced they’ve expanded their programmatic partnership to make Roku content, including The Roku Channel, available to FreeWheel demand partners through Roku Exchange. For the first time under the partnership, a new, standard protocol will enable real-time bidding among programmatic platforms, offering advertisers a rob

raw.headline: Roku and FreeWheel Announce New Programmatic Partnership
raw.summary: SAN JOSE, Calif., December 12, 2024--Today, Roku, the #1 TV streaming platform in the U.S.* and FreeWheel, a global technology platform for the television advertising industry, announced they’ve expanded their programmatic partnership to make Roku content, including The Roku Channel, available to FreeWheel demand partners through Roku Exchange. headline: Q3 Earnings Recap: Charter (NASDAQ:CHTR) Tops Wireless, Cable and Satellite Stocks
summary: The end of the earnings season is always a good time to take a step back and see who shined (and who not so much). Let’s take a look at how wireless, cable and satellite stocks fared in Q3, starting with Charter (NASDAQ:CHTR).
